Title: A Tale of Two Detectives Ep.1
SubTitle: No Translation

Text: *yawwwn* ...Hm? What is this?

It is still early in the morning. and Sherry has just
come to a stopping point in her work. She opens
the door to the lab and finds something on the
ground by her feet.
A letter addressed to me?

There's no return address... Who in the world
left it for me?

Hmmm... I don't know anyone who's the letter-writing
type. Maybe it's from someone related to my research?

But if that were the case, they wouldn't have left
it on the ground at my door...
Which means, this is letter is... Oh!
C-Could it be...from Cid?!

Maybe he wanted to tell me something he didn't want
anyone else knowing about...so he used this method!

This is my first time ever receiving a letter from
a boy... Ohh, I'm so nervous.

Her doubts from earlier disappear to who knows where.
She enthusiastically opens the envelope and pulls out
the letter.
Huh? It's...not from Cid?
Oh-whoa-whoa!

As she begins to read, she stiffens up. That's just
how shocking its contents are.

Wh-What could this possibly mean? Ohh...my
heart just won't stop racing.

Is this...one of those spam letters I sometimes
hear about? But why...
What should I do? Who would send such a thing...

Her heart is racing, but now for a very different
reason.

How am I supposed to deal with something like this?
I need to talk to somebody...

As soon as she think this, an image of his face
appears in her mind.
Hello, Cid.
Hm? Oh, hi.

Sherry waits for the morning's lessons to end and
approaches Cid just as he leaves the classroom.

Sorry for the sudden intrusion. But, um...I need your
help with something. Are you free right now?
Sure.
Ohh, thank you! Well, can we speak over there, then?
Can't we talk here?
Um, well, it's a delicate matter...
Oh, okay. Well, let's go over there, then.
Ah.
Is something wrong?
Can I buy some lunch first?
Oh! If you need lunch... If you're fine with this...
What's this?

I made some sandwiches. I knew I wanted to ask you
for help over lunch...
Thanks. Okay, let's go.
Yes!
I hope the sandwiches are to your liking, Cid...
Ooh, an egg sandwich. Nice, thanks.
Mm. Lots of mayo. Just the way I like it.
Hehehe, glad to hear you like them.
And this one's ham, right? Mm. It's really good.
So what did you want to talk about?
Cid asks as he reaches for his third sandwich.
Huh?

We're not just here to have a pleasant picnic, right?
You said you needed my help with something.
Wahhh! Th-That's right!

(Cid just looked so happy eating my sandwiches,
I completely forgot about the matter at hand!)
Actually...
She tells Cid about what happened that morning.
You got a spam letter?
Yes...I think that's what it is.

You see...when I stepped out of the lab, I found this
letter at my door.

With a tense expression and shaky hands, she gives
Cid the letter in question.
Lemme see...

"Salutations. How have you been? I am happy to
announce that the cafeteria has a new dessert menu."
Awfully polite for a spam letter.
But read after that part! Just read it!
Okay, okay. Let's see...

"Now, please forgive my sudden request, but please
stop being so friendly with Cid Kagenou."
Hm? Me?
You are the only person named Cid that I know.

I don't understand... Why does this person want me to
stop being so friendly with you?

I agree that it doesn't make sense. But...is this
really a spam letter? It sounds more like a
threat to me.

I don't sense any maliciousness in it. I mean, look
at the envelope and stationery—this is a pretty
fancy letter.

Does it being a fancy letter exempt it from being
malicious?

Most people wouldn't bother to get out their good
stationery if they wanted to bully someone.
When you put it that way...
Oh, by the way, can I have some tea?
Oh, y-yes! Go ahead!

It's written very by-the-book, too. It starts with a
greeting, then it inquires about your well-being...
and it's even signed, “best regards“ at the end.
So I'll ask again, are you sure this is a spam letter?
Well...when you put it that way, I'm not sure.

But wait! When the receiver doesn't really understand
the letter, doesn't that mean it's a spam letter?

Well... But this letter isn't exactly... No, wait,
this is interesting in its own way. I think the
configuration is a bit too weak to call it spam...
The...configuration?
Oops, sorry. Just talking to myself. Go on.
I'm just...anxious.

People know where my lab is... But what scares me the
most...is that the person who sent this letter is invisible
to me.

I cannot relax and feel safe when I don't know the
identity of the person who sent this letter.
Gotcha.
So please, Cid!
Please help me find the culprit!
So that's where this's going...
So...you can't do it?

It's not that I can't do it, exactly... This story
just took an unexpected turn, that's all. I'm
gonna play a much more active role than I
thought.

But...I don't think I mind that. A girl-detective,
chasing after a criminal with her seemingly
dull assistant taking notes... Yeah. Let's
go with that.

Um...c-can you, or can't you? You can't, right?
I know you're very busy, Cid.

(If I consulted Father for help, it would only cause
him unnecessary worry... So I thought that Cid was
the only person I could turn to...)

(But I was wrong. I shouldn't have just shoved all my
problems at him unilaterally...)
Okay, I'll do it.

It's okay, I understand... Hahaha. Please, forget I
even asked you for help today.
Oh-whoa?! Y-You can...help me?
Yes, of course.

Sherry sighs in relief at the sight of Cid's smile.
Immediately after, the painful tension in her
chest dissipates—it feels nice to be heard.

It looks like we're running out of time for lunch...
Are you free this evening, Cid? I would love to get
to the investigation right away, if possible.
I don't have any plans.

Okay, then, I'll come meet you at your classroom when
lessons are over.
You want to start the investigation after school?
Yes. I want to search the school.
I already have a lead.
Yeah?
Yes, the thought just came to me!

When you mentioned the envelope and stationery were
of high quality, I theorized that the culprit must be
wealthy.
Ah-hah.

And I think the overly-polite writing was to mask the
fact that they were not accustomed to making threats.
I see, I see. Fine detective work there.
In other words, the culprit...is an aristocrat!

The only problem is both the Midgard Academy for Dark
Knights and the Academy of Science are both full of
aristocrats.
Huh?

Meaning our suspect is either a student or
an instructor.

Ugh...that's way too many people... I suppose real
investigations don't work like they do in detective
novels.
Detective novels?

To relax during breaks in my research, I read some
books in this girl-detective series. It's called "Girllock
Holmes." They were very good—I recommend you
read them, Cid.
Girllock Holmes...

Wait, was it those books that inspired you to suggest
we look for the culprit?

N-No, of course not! Well...I suppose I was
influenced in part by those books..

The more she denies it, the more flustered she
becomes—clear even to Sherry herself.
Truly...I'm not like that!

It's nothing to be ashamed of. Oh! By the way, did
you talk to Assistant Principal Lutheran about this?
So you didn't talk to him.
I don't wish to speak to Father about it.
But why?

Father has helped me out so much ever since I lost my
mother. I wouldn't be able to do the research I do now
without his support.
So...
So you don't want to cause him unnecessary worry?
...Yes.
Understood. I won't tell him.
Oh, thank you so much!

Ever since I received that threatening letter...I've
only grown more and more anxious...

But I don't have any friends to confide in...
At first, I even hesitated to tell you because
I didn't want to trouble you.

But...I'm glad I mustered up the courage to ask you
for help.

Well, I'll come get you after class, then! Let's do
our best to find the culprit together!
